div.p: This job, I mean it’s what I want to do, strangely enough as I said when I was working in retail, for me, not for everybody,
but for me it was just mundane it wasn’t what I wanted to do and this job has given me, strange but when you do a mundane job
you just go “oh I’ve got to get up now” and that sort of thing but with this job it’s giving me a purpose to wake up you know "what’s the day going to bring?"
And for me getting up every morning, putting on my uniform, going into work and doing the job I want to do was my turning point
I’ve been in the job 3 years, 3 years is a long time but I still enjoy it, there’s people that listen to advice and there’s people that don’t
and just take a bit of advice, I’m the kind of person that thinks I’m right, you’re wrong. My mum gives me the drive and support that I need,
my dad said that I would never drive but she said “prove him wrong”. Training to get my personal flying licence
my dad said “he’ll never do that” and my mum said “prove him wrong” so that’s what I do prove people wrong, prove I can do it if I set my mind to it.
